articles.headline: Garrett Crochet stems tide for Boston Red Sox in series finale
articles.description: With the Boston Red Sox needing a win to avoid a series sweep Sunday, ace Garrett Crochet matched his season high with 12 strikeouts over six innings in his club's 6-4 victory over the rival New York Yankees at Fenway Park, improving to 16-5 this season.

images.name: Garrett Crochet silences Yankees' bats
images.caption: Garrett Crochet strikes out 12 Yankees in the Red Sox's win to avoid a sweep.

articles.headline: Mariners' Cal Raleigh ties record, sets another with 54th home run
articles.description: Mariners slugger Cal Raleigh hit his 54th home run, tying Mickey Mantle's record for a switch-hitter and passing Javy Lopez's mark for catchers in a season (43).

images.name: Raleigh ties Mantle for most HRs by switch-hitter in a season
images.caption: Cal Raleigh hits his 54th home run of the year, tying Mickey Mantle's mark for the most by a switch-hitter in a season.

articles.headline: Pete Alonso hits walk-off homer to end Mets' losing streak
articles.description: Pete Alonso hit a three-run walk-off homer to end the Mets' eight-game losing streak and reopen a 1 1/2-game lead in the race for the final NL wild-card spot.

images.name: 250914 [1296x729]
images.caption: Pete Alonso hit a three-run walk-off homer to end the Mets' eight-game losing streak and reopen a 1 1/2-game lead in the race for the final NL wild-card spot.

images.name: Pete Alonso's homer wins it for Mets in extras
images.caption: Pete Alonso blasts a 3-run walk-off homer in the 10th inning to lift the Mets past the Rangers.

article.headline: Tigers and Pirates postponed due to forecast for inclement weather, split doubleheader on Thursday
article.description: — The scheduled game between the Detroit Tigers and Pittsburgh Pirates on Wednesday night was postponed due to the forecast for inclement weather.
article.linkText: Tigers and Pirates postponed due to forecast for inclement weather, split doubleheader on Thursday
article.story: DETROIT -- — The scheduled game between the Detroit Tigers and Pittsburgh Pirates on Wednesday night was postponed due to the forecast for inclement weather. Heavy rain hit the Detroit area early Wednesday afternoon, and with heavy storms expected during the evening, the game was called off about two hours before the scheduled first pitch. The game will be played as a part of a split doubleheader on Thursday, with the first game scheduled for 1:10 p.m. and the second at 5:40 p.m. Two of baseball's top starting pitchers — Detroit's Tarik Skubal and Pittsburgh's Paul Skenes — are scheduled to pitch on Thursday, but will not face each other. Skubal (7-2, 1.99 ERA) will face Pittsburgh left-hander Andrew Heaney (3-5, 3.33) in the first game. Skenes (4-6, 1.78) will go against a Tigers opener in the nightcap. ------ AP MLB: https://apnews.com/hub/mlb
